name: Granulomatous Periorificial Dermatitis
chief_complaint: Bumpy red rash around my mouth and nose that won't go away
physical_findings: Erythematous papules in perioral and perinasal distribution
treatment: Discontinuation of topical steroids if being used
Oral doxycycline 100mg daily for moderate cases
prognosis: Good with proper treatment, though may take 6-8 weeks for full resolution
description: A chronic inflammatory dermatosis characterized by small, monomorphous, erythematous papules and pustules localized around the mouth, nose, and sometimes eyes. Often confused with acne or rosacea, but distinguished by its unique distribution and lack of comedones.
risk_factors: Female gender (more common in young women)
